docs.snippet: On a gray morning in February, 1920, a court of inquiry assembled in the gloomy Law Courts of London on the Strand. The court was met to arbitrate the plea of the dockers of Britain for a living wage of sixteen shillings (the equivalent of about...
docs.lead_paragraph: On a gray morning in February, 1920, a court of inquiry assembled in the gloomy Law Courts of London on the Strand. The court was met to arbitrate the plea of the dockers of Britain for a living wage of sixteen shillings (the equivalent of about $3.20 at that time) a day.
